text:
Question 180) On February 20, 2011, the Bulusan volcano's large eruption in the Philippines took place. Its geographical location on the terrestrial globe is given by GPS (acronym for global positioning system) with a longness of 124 ° 3 '0 ”east of Greenwich meridian.
Given: 1 ° equals 60 'and 1' equals 60 ”.
The angular representation of the location of the volcano regarding its longitude in the decimal form is
A) 124.02 °.
B) 124.05 °.
C) 124.20 °.
D) 124.30 °.
E) 124.50 °.
